message: This could be  a way for participants to communicate while at Sage Summit 2011 in July. The benefit would be that you could see at a glimpse what might have happened in sessions that you weren't able to attend.
The downside is you need to lug around a laptop (or iPad) -- as there's no mobile client for this (maybe by July there will be?)

In essence this is like a big discussion forum - where you could create new topics as you go into different sessions and make observations or notes. Others could see what they missed or add their own observations - maybe even after the fact. What's left at the end of the day is a set of notes and comments about a session - useful for anyone who didn't make it to the course or who perhaps wasn't paying attention..

I also do not see this as worth advertising in advance - -it will be for a small pool of active online participants. From the prior year I know we're able to attract lots of lurkers (easy a 50:1 ratio of lurkers to active users).
It gives us some time to try it out. It's not nearly as collaborative as the Google Wave project was.
The Insightful Google Group still exists. When it gets closer we could do a blast to that group.
I actually really like Beluga as a quick group chat (the integration to SMS is pretty seamless for those without smartphones)

The problem with groups is that you get 1,000 lurkers and 2 participants. I'm not sure whether it will be worth our time to go back and get people to participate. Are we getting others to participate or should we just focus on increasing our group participation?
